page.title: 17LANGAR AIRFIELD
page.content:
In the second world war the land to the south of Langar was used to make an{airfield.Lancaster bombers}were serviced and repaired after nightly raids into Germany. The American Airforce and later the Canadians were stationed here.In the later part of the war it was also used as a{prisoner of war camp }and during their stay the prisoners became an accepted part of village life. After the war many villagers worked in the hangars making peace time aircraft for{Hawker Siddley Aviation. When this firm closed new industries moved in like{Reed Corrugated Cases and{John Deere}Tractors.Many villagers still work at these factories. The airfield today is mostly farmland but it is also used for parachuting.
{
